title: Operations Supervisor
description:
**Overview**  
The New York Public Library is a free provider of education and information for the people of New York and beyond. With 92 locations—including research and branch libraries—throughout the Bronx, Manhattan, and Staten Island, the Library offers free materials, computer access, classes, exhibitions, programming and more to everyone from toddlers to scholars, and has seen record numbers of attendance and circulation in recent years. The New York Public Library serves more than 18 million patrons who come through its doors annually and millions more around the globe who use its resources at www.nypl.org.The Facilities department is tasked with keeping all NYPL locations safe, clean, comfortable and welcoming for our patrons and staff. The Operations Supervisor provides direction to a team of 10 - 14 custodians and coordinates the day to day cleaning operations of the Library buildings in an assigned network. This includes organizing, distributing and verifying the work of the custodial/porter staff and participating in their training. They also perform custodial duties, if necessary.

**We are looking for someone we can count on to:**

**Own**:

* All aspects of cleaning operations in a neighborhood library network.
* Supervision of the performance of assigned Facilities staff
* Completion of building audits to ensure compliance with accepted Library standards
* Staff scheduling; assign and inspect work to assure the highest quality results

**Grow:**

* Staff skills and knowledge in cleaning methods and techniques, and on the use of chemicals and machinery

**Learn:**

* How the Facilities Department interacts with other divisions and departments
* How to improve critical work functions and efficiencies in operations

**Improve**:

* The ability of NYPL to provide Library Patrons and Staff with a safe and welcoming environment

**Some expectations for this role are that within:1 month**, this person will:

* Understand how the library is organized and physically laid out
* Understand the specific goals and role of the Facilities Operations team in relation to other departments
* Know their departmental contacts
* Perform daily building inspections

**3 months**, this person will:

* Provide direction, motivation and set an example through open communication and modeling best practices. Demonstrate ability to motivate others to meet a common goal; and, recognize and effectively leverages employees’ skills and abilities.
* Provide meaningful and appropriate advice, on-going feedback, support and resources to improve effectiveness of individuals and teams. Address performance problems in an appropriate and timely manner.

**6 months and beyond**, this person will:

* Train custodial staff on proper techniques and procedures for Cleaning Operations
* Perform inspections and assessments independently
* Meet the expectations of internal and external customers.Listen and respond effectively to customer questions; resolve customer problems to the customer’s satisfaction; respect all internal and external customers.
* Support a positive team environment in which members participate, respect and cooperate with each other to receive desired results.
* Plans, prioritizes, and organizes work effectively to produce measurable results; keeps current with and effectively applies new work methods, skills and technologies to complete work.

**Responsibilities**

* Supervises the performance of custodial/porter staff and conducts building audits to ensure compliance with accepted Library standards.
* Schedules staff, assigns and inspects work to assure the highest quality results
* Organizes snow removal, grounds maintenance and site specific tasks, oversees special assignments and determines crew sizes, and ensures projects are competed in a timely manner
* Tracks inventory levels at assigned buildings and replenishes supplies as needed
* Oversees implementation of schedules for daily and periodic services and resolves scheduling problems
* Maintains ongoing communication with Library managers and staff to determine needs
* Must be available to respond to emergencies after hours. Emergency response to weather events and systems failures; organize snow removal, grounds maintenance and site specific tasks

Required Education, Experience & Skills

**Required Education & Certifications**

* HS Diploma or equivalent, and a strong background in building cleaning or equivalent combination education and experience
* Valid driver’s license and a clear driving record

**Required Experience**

* 3 plus years of successfully demonstrated supervisory experience

**Required Skills**

* Demonstrated knowledge of industry standard cleaning methods and procedures, materials safety handling, and experience ordering and maintaining supplies and equipment
* Successful demonstrated ability to perform manual work consisting of cleaning, heavy lifting, and working from high ladders and scaffolds
* Must be able to communicate with staff, management at all levels and outside vendors/ contractors
* Good interpersonal skills, oral and written communication skills including demonstrating the ability to work well with Library staff at all levels
* Must be able to work flexible schedules and perform operational duties in an emergency
* Must pass physical examination

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Some college education
* Knowledge of mixing chemicals to prepare cleaning solutions, according to specifications.
* Knowledge of using commercial cleaning equipment

More...**Core Values**  
*All team members are expected and encouraged to embody the NYPL Core Values:*

* Be **Helpful** to patrons and colleagues
* Be **Resourceful** in solving problems
* Be **Curious** in all aspects of your work
* Be **Welcoming** and **Inclusive**

**Work Environment**

* Monday - Friday 6:00am - 2:30pm
* Evenings and weekends as necessary

**Physical Duties**

* Lifting requirements - YES, Ability to lift up to 50lbs
* Moderate physical effort is required
* Travel requirements - Local NYC
* Valid driver’s license and a clear driving record

**Pre-Placement** **Physical Required?**  
Yes/No

**Union/Non Union**  
Non-Union

**FLSA Status**  
Non-Exempt

**Schedule**  
*This job description represents the types and levels of responsibilities that will be required of the position and shall not be construed as a declaration of all of the specific duties and responsibilities for the role. Job duties may change if Library priorities change. Employees may be directed to perform job-related tasks other than those specifically presented in this description as needed.*

***The New York Public Library******Salary Statement***

At the Library, we believe that pay transparency and pay equity are important to ensuring we source the best candidates and keep the best employees. When making a determination as to the appropriate salary for a candidate, we consider a variety of factors such, including, but not limited to, the position requirements, the skills, prior experience, and educational background required or preferred for the job, the scope and impact of the role within the organization, internal peer equity, and the candidate's specific training, experience, education level, and skills. No single factor is conclusive; the Library reserves the right to consider any and all relevant factors and make a decision consistent with its policies. Union Salaries are determined by collective bargaining agreement(s).

About The New York Public Library

The New York Public Library is a free provider of education and information for the people of New York and beyond. With 92 locations—including research and branch libraries—throughout the Bronx, Manhattan, and Staten Island, the Library offers free materials, computer access, classes, exhibitions, programming and more to everyone from toddlers to scholars, and has seen record numbers of attendance and circulation in recent years. The New York Public Library serves more than 18 million patrons who come through its doors annually and millions more around the globe who use its resources at www.nypl.org.

title: Associate Director, Brand Experience
description:
**Job Description**  

The Associate Director, Brand Experience is the day-to-day steward of media planning for assigned brands, including accurate budget control and flow of online and traditional media activity. They will be required to develop and maintain a strong knowledge of their clients’ business and apply their media understanding accordingly to help deliver against the clients’ needs/objectives. They will work closely with direct managers in the development and communication of all media recommendations.  



**Role Objectives:**

* Lead cross-channel planning for digital & traditional channels (National and Local)
* Apply and leverage agency tools to build insight driven recommendations that deliver on client business goals/objectives
* Successful at building strong, collaborative client relationships, instilling trust and authority on behalf of the agency
* Ability to manage timelines, projects and personnel within direct report team and across cross-functional teams - making independent decisions and identifying team priorities
* Flexible and able to keep up with a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment, and the ability to successfully manage multiple work streams at one time
* Strong foundation in strategic and critical thinking, finding ways to innovate and collaborate with teams to improve outputs
* Maintain an in-depth knowledge of current media industry news and brand business (current and historical)
* Individual should possess confidence, composure, and polished presentation skills to effectively attend and lead in-person meetings with key clients on a daily basis
* Self-motivation and organization are key due to coordination with multiple internal and external clients
* Serve as a resource for direct reports to resolve complex questions/problems; Be able to identify and promote solutions
* Build team expertise by mentoring junior team members and offering training in relevant methodologies, techniques, frameworks, etc.
* Review all client deliverables for quality, ensuring that recommendations and work product are of the highest excellence
* Responsible for daily budget management, following agency process, and ensuring accuracy/timeliness
* Perform duties and responsibilities that management may deem necessary from time to time

  

**Qualifications** **Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree or higher in advertising, marketing, business, or similar areas or equivalent experience
* 5+ years of experience in media planning with progressive levels of responsibility
* 2+ years of previous management experience
* Experience across multiple media types (national, local, digital, direct, programmatic, shopper, etc)
* Experience in Pharma a plus
* MediaTools knowledge and experience (budget management)
* Natural leader who knows what it takes to manage a group, even when a lot of moving parts are involved
* Able to take care of the day-to-day part of overseeing others and good at helping them grow and realize their own potential
* Strategic thinker, someone who takes into account the bigger picture
* Demonstrates innate curiosity and motivation
* Track record with building great relationships and has a “can do” mentality of getting the job done right
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Proficiency with Excel & PowerPoint

  

**Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Compensation Range: $91,000 - $144,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 10/11/2024.

title: Culinary Training Manager (Bilingual in Mandarin)
description:
*The*\\_ **Culinary Training Manager (bilingual in Mandarin)** *\\_plays a crucial role within the Ugly Dumpling Organization, overseeing the culinary training programs. This multifaceted position involves designing comprehensive curricula, developing training materials, leading NSO (New Store Opening) training initiatives, and actively collaborating with the Executive Chef on product development and cost management. In addition, the Culinary Training Director is responsible for integrating robust food safety training into the curriculum, ensuring that our culinary teams are well-versed in best practices and compliance standards for a safe and hygienic kitchen environment.*

**Duties & Responsibilities**

Primary responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:

* Design and develop comprehensive culinary training programs that align with the restaurant's culinary philosophy, standards, and goals.
* Create training materials, manuals, and resources for both new hires and ongoing professional development.
* Develop and deliver comprehensive onboarding programs for new culinary team members, providing them with the necessary skills and knowledge to excel in their roles.
* Administer hands-on training at New Store Openings (“NSO”).
* Ensure Regional Managers, Store Management, and company trainers are well-versed in specific restaurant openings and training skills.
* Audit materials to ensure compliance with SOP updates and new restaurant needs/programs
* Collaborate with the Executive Chef in developing new menu items.
* Manage recipe database, inventory tracking system, and cost analysis
* Create and maintain a robust food safety program, including procedures for handling, storage, and preparation, to ensure compliance with industry regulations and standards.
* Facilitate ongoing professional development opportunities for kitchen staff, including workshops, seminars, and mentorship programs.
* Stay current with industry trends and culinary innovations, integrating relevant updates into training programs.
* Maintain clear and open communication channels with kitchen staff to address concerns, provide constructive feedback, and encourage a positive learning environment.
* Foster a culture of continuous improvement and teamwork within the culinary team.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**Essential Functions** 

* Back of house food service experience.
* Experience working with Everclean or Steritech.
* Servsafe Food Safety Manager – Servsafe Proctor and Instructor preferred.
* Prior experience managing training solutions in a restaurant environment.
* Proficient in Microsoft Suites.
* Excellent written and verbal communication
* Experience in creating training materials and video-based content.
* Ability to travel frequently with flexible working hours.
* Travel time subject to change: approx. 50% of the month (this includes out-of-state).

*Vertex Hospitality Group provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability status, genetic information (including family medical history), marital status, amnesty, status as a covered veteran or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state and local laws.*

title: Server (Substitute)
company: Resorts World Casino New York City
description:
**Job Description**



The **Server** is responsible for creating the overall guest experience, taking food & beverage orders, carrying out wine/beverage service, performing table maintenance, completing side work, maintaining health code standards, and providing excellent customer service for our guests as defined by outlet standards.


**Essential Duties**


* Prompt, efficient and friendly quality service to any and all guests of the restaurants.
* Comply with all department and company rules, regulations, policies, procedures, internal controls and government rules and regulations.
* Maintain current and accurate knowledge of all menu items
* Service all beverage (both alcoholic and non-alcoholic) in food outlets.
* Bus tables in station and completes all side work.
* Assist restaurant host/hostess when required.
* Attend periodic meetings and training sessions.
* Provide outstanding customer and employee service at all times.
* Present a neat and clean appearance at all times.
* Perform other duties as assigned.


**Job Requirements**



To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each job responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


*Physical and Mental* *Demands:*



The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by the Team Member to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.



While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. The employee is also regularly required to stand, walk, sit, and use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms, and to sit, climb or balance, and stoop, stretch, bend, kneel, crouch, or crawl.



Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. Essential responsibilities include moderate physical ability such as lift or maneuver at least twenty-five (25) pounds, and varied instances of standing/walking.


*Language Skills:*



Ability to read, analyze, and interpret documents, such as policy and procedure manuals, maintenance instructions, and other related documents. Ability to respond to common inquiries from other employees or guests. Fluency in English required, second language a plus. Ability to write detailed instructions and correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and group situations.


*Mathematical Skills & Reasoning Ability:*



Ability to compute basic mathematical calculations. Ability to decipher various reports and maintains reports upon request.


*Work Environment:*

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that exists while employees are performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


* The noise level in the work environment is typically moderate. When on the property or some back of house areas, the noise level increases to loud. Must be able to interact with internal and external guests in a professional manner.
* Due to the unpredictable nature of the hospitality/entertainment industry, employees must be able to work varying schedules to reflect the business needs of the property.


*Work/Educational Experience*


* Must be at least 18 years old, possess a high school or equivalent diploma and have the ability to obtain the appropriate license pursuant to the New York State Lottery regulations.
* At least one (1) year related culinary work
* ABC license


*Salary*


***Hourly rate of $16.2737 - $21.6983***


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Wound Care Nurse RN - Full time
description:
Registered Nurse
  
  

At RestorixHealth, our mission is simple…to restore health and improve the quality of life – and access to care – for patients with wounds.
  
  

Our Wound Care Registered Nurses (will train) are the heart and soul behind what we do. Utilizing the Nursing Process, the RN plans, implements, directs, and evaluates patient care to achieve optimal outcomes. The Wound Care Nurse works collaboratively with all other disciplines on the assigned unit. Additionally, the RN prioritizes nursing actions and will implement physician orders accurately within appropriate time frames. Ongoing training will provide you with the tools to be successful in your role.
  
  

Take your passion for enhancing the lives of patients and turn it into a career, join the RestorixHealth Team and APPLY TODAY!
  
  

**What We Offer:**  

* Monday - Friday schedule, no weekends
* RestorixHealth is proud to provide employees with a comprehensive and attractive benefits program which includes the following:
* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
* Health Savings Account (with employer match) and Flexible Spending Accounts (General Purpose, Limited Purpose, and Dependent Care)
* Employer-Paid Basic Life Insurance, AD&D and Short-Term Disability
* Voluntary Buy-Up Life Insurance (for self, spouse & children), Short-Term Disability and Long-Term Disability
* Voluntary Accident, Critical Illness and Hospital Indemnity Plans
* Employee Assistance Program
* Pet Care Discount Program
* Generous Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays
* 401(k) Retirement Plan (with employer match)
* Internal ongoing educational/training opportunities
* Competitive compensation
* Continuous coaching & mentorship


**What You’ll Do:**  

* Provide patient care based on scientific principles/nursing theory and evidence-based practice
* Recognize change in the patient’s condition and intervene appropriately
* Prioritize nursing actions including reflecting patient needs, acuity, and desired outcomes
* Implement physician orders accurately within appropriate time frames
* Educate and counsel patients and their families on wound care processes and issues


**Qualifications:**  

* Associate degree in nursing, Bachelor of Science in Nursing required for Magnet Hospitals
* Valid Registered Nursing license required
* Valid CPR certification from the American Heart Association required
* Prior experience working with wound care patients (Will train)
* Prior experience with billing and coding preferred


At RestorixHealth, we grow talent. When you join our team, you have the opportunity to develop your career based on your strengths and potential, including the possibility to move functionally, geographically, laterally, and vertically. This is a career destination for engaged, caring, passionate and talented people who want to make a difference. We are the leader in the development and management of comprehensive wound healing and Amputation Prevention Center facilities.
  
  

RestorixHealth is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, or marital status.

title: Bilingual French language Instructor for kids after school program- September and on - (E. 70's)
description:
Parker Anderson Enrichment NYC is looking to hire **very part time after-school enrichment instructors to teach one hour after school on a set schedule**. Pay minimum is $50 per class. It's about a 1 hour commitment with 1 hour of active teaching), paid as an independent contractor through zelle pay once per month. Most of our teachers teach 1-3 classes per week 1 hour per day (depending on schedule/availability).  
Classes are immediately after school and on site at schools starting in September or October. **Most classes run from 3-4 pm and you would need to arrive by 2:30 pm or so on site. Occasionally schools book classes at 3:30 pm.** Please only apply if you have this time period available at least once or twice per week and factor in any commutes you may have.

**Details for French Immersion** 

Parlez-vous français? Would you like to learn French? Grammar and conjugation rules will be taught but we do not use the “by heart” method, we favor the intuitive aspect of learning through original activities. You'll learn typical French expressions, pronunciation and French culture too. Lessons are presented in an interactive, colorful way- full of games, riddles, jokes, and animations to help time fly by!

This class does not come with a curriculum and you must develop your own..

Our classes run anywhere from 8 weeks to 18 weeks, again depending on the school. We share all school information and ask that you make sure all times, dates, subjects work for you before committing. We provide curriculum for our classes, but would prefer instructors who can enhance and adapt our curriculum. Pay is $60 per class (up to an hour of active teaching, though you are expected to arrive at least 20 minutes before start time.) We pay higher for specialized classes like piano, guitar, dance, and ASL (where instructors would need to provide their own curriculum) and very experienced teachers. 90 minute classes also pay a $75 minimum.

Class Specifics

Neighborhood: Upper East side (E.70's)

Dates: 9/23/24 - 12/9/24 (Mondays)

Time: 2:45pm -3:25pm

Grades: Prek-k

Requirements:  
-**Must have NYCDOE (New York City Department of Education) fingerprint clearance OR willingness to obtain (it's easy and we can nominate you. It is a prerequisite of employment- it does not expire)**   
-**afternoon availability to be on site at a Upper West Side, Upper East Side, midtown, lower Manhattan or Brooklyn (depending on school schedule and your location preferences ) around 2:30 pm. Most classes run from 3 until 4 pm with around an hour of active teaching time or around that time frame. Please let us know if you are also open to Hoboken, NJ.**  
**- be fully vaccinated and boosted (vaccination is an NYC school requirement, though some of our schools require boosters too)**  
- **experience working with elementary aged group of students**  
This job is perfect for part time teachers, substitutes, retired educators, students, part time employees, etc. - basically anyone who has other things going on in their life where the time commitment availability for mid-afternoon teaching will not be a problem/conflict and who has other things going on in their life and could use extra cash.  
Please send a resume, a little blurb about yourself and note your availability for a short preliminary phone/zoom interview. We will respond to all qualified, local candidates.

Here is a sample of classes we teach: https://www.paenynj.org/classdescriptions

As of right now we are actively hiring for: Cartoon animation and comics creation, piano, chess, soccer, programmable robots, French Immersion, LEGO, Spanish Immersion, Digital Photography, Healthy Kids Club, Music Kids, Pokemon Arts Academy, Group Piano, and Hip Hop dancing.

If there is anything you would like us to consider you for you can submit a short recorded video of about 5 min or so showcasing your teaching style/skills for a young elementary aged group class, we’d appreciate it and can follow up with a very short phone or zoom call interview. We can also send you one or two of our typical lessons, if you prefer to showcase something from our curriculum. If you would like to create/share a short instructional video please do so.

title: Design Consultant
description:
Our Sales and Design Consultants are the keepers of our most important relationships and joy-makers who believe there is real purpose in helping others design better lives, where they are free to focus on what matters most.

In this role, you’ll work directly with our clients to create closets and storage solutions customized to their needs during virtual and in-home consultations and in our design showrooms.

A successful Sales and Design Consultant doesn’t necessarily have prior experience. We will get you started with the design and sales training and tools you need for success. From there, your opportunity for growth is virtually unlimited: It all comes down to you, with our full support along the way.

What will make you successful in this role is your desire to learn and grow, your passion for making a difference, and your ability to listen to customers’ ideas and transform an everyday space into one that truly improves their lives.

Here, you’ll find the freedom and flexibility of an entrepreneur with the support system of an industry-leading company. The ability to wear different hats — and to thrive while doing so — is a plus.

If you are hardworking, want to be part of a family culture, love forging relationships with customers, are energized by creating tranquility and order, and are committed to unrivaled customer service and delivering excellence, then there is a home for you here.

What We Offer:

⦁ Paid training  
⦁ Paid salary while training. Full commission structure after 1st year.  
⦁ No commission max  
⦁ Professional development opportunities  
⦁ Medical and other insurance benefits are available  
⦁ 401K and Profit Sharing

What Will You Do?

⦁ Manage all facets of the sales cycle, from initial inquiry through final installation  
⦁ Design solutions that inspire and meet client needs using proprietary CAD software to complete design specifications  
⦁ Develop ongoing client relationships  
⦁ Maintain an ongoing consultation schedule through company and independently generated leads  
⦁ Stay updated and understand industry trends that include organization, fashion, and interior design  
⦁ Build relationships with clients and potential clients through networking  
⦁ Work Design Showroom shifts as scheduled by management

What You Need:

⦁ Education in Interior Design, Architecture, or equivalent experience.

⦁ Prior sales experience is a plus  
⦁ Passion for organization, design, and helping people  
⦁ Strong communication and listening skills  
⦁ A desire to learn, grow and build relationships with customers  
⦁ Ability to work with computer software and to learn CAD programs  
⦁ Valid Driver’s License

Life at California Closets

Are you craving something more out of your work life? More inspiration, a better culture, the chance to make an impact, the opportunity to learn and grow? Maybe you have a job, but you’re looking for a career.

At California Closets, we’re designing a better work-life for all of our employees by investing in skills, encouraging growth, and celebrating excellence.

We take pride in providing our people access to opportunities, training, and support that empowers them to succeed in both work, and life. Coming to work with us feels a lot like finding a home.

We want to be the best employer and the longest career for anyone who has the energy, drive, and desire to serve.

Working here is more than a job. It’s a career. And we want to help you make it the career of your dreams.

Our commission-based compensation structure allows our Sales and Design Consultants to reap the benefits of a job well done. If you’re a sales-driven, networking champion with a flair for creativity, apply to be a California Closets Design Consultant today.

description:
**Job Description**



The **Lead/Dual Slot Ambassador** is responsible for assisting Slot Supervisor with everyday routine when scheduled as a lead. This position is also responsible for trouble shooting and assisting guests with their slot machine issues and performs repair minor gaming machine malfunctions.


**Essential Duties**


* Explain various game combinations payouts and jackpots to guests.
* Reset Slots whenever necessary.
* Respond to all customers’ needs in assigned area.
* Render general assistance to gaming players and forwards complaints to management as necessary.
* Safeguard company assets and gaming keys.
* Replace gaming machine tickets.
* Assist customers with gaming machines where necessary and also provides directions, general information upcoming events and assists with Slot operation and services.
* Promote excellent customer service by answering patron questions, understands all marketing & property information and rendering general assistance when necessary.
* Maintain an open line of communications with superiors.
* Assist customers with player card sign ups.
* Maintain a professional appearance at all times.
* Demonstrate and provide outstanding customer and employee relations at all times.
* Present oneself in a neat and clean appearance at all times.
* Perform other duties as assigned.


**Job Requirements**



To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each job responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


*Physical and Mental Demands:*



The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by the Team Member to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.



While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. The employee is also regularly required to stand, walk, sit, and use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms, and to sit, climb or balance, and stoop, stretch, bend, kneel, crouch, or crawl.



Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. Essential responsibilities include moderate physical ability such as lift or maneuver at least thirty (30) pounds, and varied instances of standing/walking.


*Language Skills:*



Ability to read, analyze, and interpret documents, such as policy and procedure manuals, maintenance instructions, and other related documents. Ability to respond to common inquiries from other employees or guests. Fluency in English required, bilingual in an Asian language may be required depending on outlet and/or location. Ability to write detailed instructions and correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and group situations.


*Mathematical Skills & Reasoning Ability:*



Ability to compute basic mathematical calculations. Ability to decipher various reports and maintains reports upon request. Ability to analyze situations in a calm and rational manner and render an appropriate decision.


*Work Environment:*

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that exists while employees are performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


* The noise level in the work environment is typically moderate. When on the property or some back of house areas, the noise level increases to loud. Must be able to interact with internal and external guests in a professional manner.
* Due to the unpredictable nature of the hospitality/entertainment industry, employees must be able to work varying schedules to reflect the business needs of the property.


*Work/Educational Experience*


* Must be at least 18 years old, possess a high school or equivalent diploma and have the ability to obtain the appropriate license pursuant to the New York State Lottery regulations


Two (2) years’ related work experience preferred.

  


**Salary Range: $30.0137 - $40.0812**

However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Retail Manager
description:
**Job Title: Retail Manager**

**Job Description:** 

As a Retail Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of the retail operations within the designated shops at our City House and Travers Island locations as well as the online store. You will be tasked with ensuring exceptional customer service, maximizing sales and profitability, managing inventory, and leading a team of retail associates to achieve performance targets and organizational goals.

**Education, Skills Required:**

* Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Retail Management, or related field.
* Proven experience in retail management and product purchasing with a track record of achieving sales targets and delivering exceptional customer service.
* Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire a team.
* Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office and retail management software.
* Knowledge of retail industry trends and best practices.
* Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and holidays as needed.

**Key Responsibilities Areas**

**Leadership and Team Management:**

* Recruit, train, develop, supervise, and motivate retail staff.
* Set performance expectations and provide regular feedback to team members.
* Foster a positive work environment and resolve any employee conflicts or issues.
* Lead by example, demonstrating excellent customer service and sales techniques.

**Sales and Customer Service:**

* Develop and implement strategies to drive sales and meet revenue targets.
* Monitor sales performance and analyze data to identify areas for improvement.
* Ensure that customers receive exceptional service and address any customer complaints or concerns promptly.
* Train staff in product knowledge and sales techniques to enhance customer experience.
* Creation of special orders for events.

**Inventory Management:**

* Manage inventory levels to optimize sales and minimize stock shortages or overages.
* Coordinate with suppliers and vendors to ensure timely replenishment of stock.
* Conduct regular inventory audits and implement procedures to prevent loss or shrinkage.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to forecast demand and inventory replenishment strategies.
* Budget management monthly/yearly to meet departmental metrics.

**Purchasing:**

* Develop and implement strategic purchasing plans that align with organizational objectives and budgetary constraints and goals.
* Source and maintain vendor relationships based on quality, reliability, price, and service levels.
* Oversee the end-to-end procurement of goods, from selection, purchase to receiving in inventory.

**Visual Merchandising:**

* Oversee the layout and presentation of merchandise to maximize visual appeal and sales.
* Ensure that displays are updated regularly and comply with company standards and promotional guidelines.

**Financial Management:**

* Monitor expenses and manage budgets effectively to maximize profitability.
* Analyze sales data and trends to make informed decisions regarding pricing, promotions, and product assortment.
* Implement cost-saving measures without compromising quality or customer service.

**Compliance and Safety:**

* Ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements.
* Maintain a safe and clean store environment, adhering to health and safety standards.
* Train staff on safety protocols and emergency procedures.

**Conclusion:**

The Retail Manager plays a crucial role in driving sales, maintaining operational efficiency, and ensuring customer satisfaction within the retail environment. This position requires strong leadership, strategic thinking, and a passion for delivering excellent service. If you thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic setting and have a knack for driving results, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

title: Director of Impact - NYC
description:
**ORGANIZATION OVERVIEW**



Urban Resource Institute (URI) is a dynamic, innovative, and well-respected organization founded in 1980 that transforms the lives of domestic violence survivors and homeless families through safe shelter and comprehensive services; delivers prevention and intervention programs that break cycles of violence and poverty; and actively works for sustainable systemic change. URI is the oldest licensed provider of domestic violence (DV) shelter and services in New York State and is the largest provider in the United States of DV shelter services, as well as a leading provider of shelter and services for homeless families. URI has a deep commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion among leadership, staff, and clients at residential and nonresidential sites across New York City.


**POSITION OVERVIEW**

The Quality Improvement, Evaluation, and Training (QIET) department is seeking a Director of Impact to design and manage strategies for measuring impact across URI’s programs. This role will lead the implementation of the Theory of Change (TOC) across the Programs Division, including the creation of logic models and impact metrics to effectively demonstrate outcomes.


**Salary: is $90,000 - $100,000**


**MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Lead execution for all impact-related activities across the Programs Division in partnership with department and program leaders.
* Train Impact Champions across URI’s programs to manage impact-related activities within their respective teams.
* Co-lead the biannual update of existing logic models and the development of new logic models for URI’s residential and non-residential programs, serving as a "road map" to illustrate the interdependencies between program resources, activities, outputs, and intended outcomes.
* Lead impact measurement for the core outcome categories of safety, housing security, and economic justice.
* Partner with the Director of Evaluation to support analytics and reporting activities on a quarterly basis.
* Align contract deliverable activities and outputs with the broader impact goals and objectives across programs.
* Coordinate and manage strategy implementation project plans, ensuring accountability across all program areas and functions involved, while tracking timelines, deliverables, and progress towards achieving the KPIs.
* Deliver regular reports on implementation progress, impact assessment findings, and provide recommendations for strategic adjustments based on learning and continuous improvement.
* Work closely with the Director of Evaluation to support the standardization of delivery and documentation of core services across URI’s programs so that they align with the Theory of Change strategies and intended impact, including but not limited to intake, case management, housing placement, and discharge.
* Collaborate closely with the Director of Evaluation to improve URI’s service delivery model/programming based on learnings and continuous improvement.


**SPECIFICATIONS FOR EDUCATION/CERTIFICATIONS/LICENSES**


* A master’s degree in fields such as Education, Psychology, Social Work, Social Sciences, Public Policy, or a related area.
* At least 3-6 years of experience in program evaluation, impact measurement, and/or research design, preferably in a non-profit or human services setting.


**REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE**


* Deep passion for URI's mission, vision, and core values, with the ability to inspire others through effective communication.
* Strong strategic thinking skills with the ability to turn ideas into practical, actionable plans.
* Proven ability to collaborate across teams and drive successful outcomes.
* Demonstrated experience in leading and managing multiple projects simultaneously.
* Expertise in measurement and evaluation, using insights to shape strategy and foster continuous improvement in nonprofit, education, government, or private sector settings.
* Ability to create clear and impactful data visualizations for a variety of data sets (qualitative and quantitative) and audiences.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.


**SPECIFICATIONS FOR PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**


* Will be required to read printed and handwritten materials.
* Will be required to manipulate the computer mouse and keyboard.
* Will be required to read information on computer screen.
* Will be required to use computer keyboard and mouse.
* Must be able to sit for long periods of time.
* Must be able to enter information in digital forms and spreadsheets.


At URI we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment. We actively seek a diverse candidate pool and encourage candidates of all backgrounds and abilities to apply. At URI we offer equal opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic disposition, neurodiversity, disability, veteran status, or any other protected category under federal, state and local law.

#### **Education**


Required* Masters or better

#### **Job Description**


Job Title: LoanIQ Business Analyst


Job Summary:


We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced LoanIQ Business Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of LoanIQ software and processes, as well as excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. The LoanIQ Business Analyst will work closely with stakeholders to understand business requirements, analyze data, and provide solutions to improve efficiency and effectiveness.

2. Work with stakeholders to identify and define data and system requirements.


3. Develop and maintain documentation related to LoanIQ processes and procedures.

5. Perform user acceptance testing and provide training to end users.


6. Troubleshoot issues and provide ongoing support to users.


7. Stay current on industry trends and best practices related to LoanIQ software.


Qualifications and Skills:


1. Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, or related field.


2. 3+ years of experience working with LoanIQ software.


3. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.


4. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.


5. Ability to work independently and in a team environment.


6. Knowledge of financial services industry.


7. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.

title: Bilingual Spanish language Instructor at after school program- September and on classes- (E. 70's)
description:
Parker Anderson Enrichment NYC is looking to hire **very part time after-school enrichment instructors to teach one hour after school on a set schedule**. Pay minimum is $75 per class. It's about a 1 hour 20 minute commitment with 1 hour of active teaching), paid as an independent contactor through zelle pay once per month. Most of our teachers teach 1-3 classes per week 1 hour per day (depending on schedule/availability).  
Classes are immediately after school and on site at schools starting in September or October. **Most classes run from 3-4 pm and you would need to arrive by 2:30 pm or so on site. Occassionally schools book classes at 3:30 pm.** Please only apply if you have this time period available at least once or twice per week and factor in any commutes you may have.

**Details for Spanish Immersion**

Designed for young students, Spanish Immersion teaches conversational and basic Spanish language using Total Physical Response (TPR)- a "learn by doing" approach. Every activity has students speaking, listening, acting and learning, and is enriched by studies of Spanish and Latin American cultures!

This class comes with curriculum.

Our classes run anywhere from 8 weeks to 18 weeks, again depending on the school. We share all school information and ask that you make sure all times, dates, subjects work for you before committing. We provide curriculum for our classes, but would prefer instructors who can enhance and adapt our curriculum. Pay is $50 per class (up to an hour of active teaching, though you are expected to arrive at least 20 minutes before start time.) We pay higher for specialized classes like piano, guitar, dance, and ASL (where instructors would need to provide their own curriculum) and very experienced teachers. 90 minute classes also pay a $75 minimum.

**Dates for the class:** 9/26/24 - 12/12/24

**Times:** 2:45pm- 3:25pm

**Grades:** prek-k

**Neighborhood:** Upper East Side (E. 70's)

Requirements:  
-**Must have NYCDOE (New York City Department of Education) fingerprint clearance OR willingness to obtain (it's easy and we can nominate you. It is a prerequisite of employment- it does not expire)**   
-**afternoon availability to be on site at a Upper West Side, Upper East Side, midtown, lower Manhattan or Brooklyn (depending on school schedule and your location preferences ) around 2:30 pm. Most classes run from 3 until 4 pm with around an hour of active teaching time or around that time frame. Please let us know if you are also open to Hoboken, NJ.**  
**- be fully vaccinated and boosted (vaccination is an NYC school requirement, though some of our schools require boosters too)**  
- **experience working with elementary aged group of students**  
This job is perfect for part time teachers, substitutes, retired educators, students, part time employees, etc. - basically anyone who has other things going on in their life where the time commitment availability for mid-afternoon teaching will not be a problem/conflict and who has other things going on in their life and could use extra cash.  
Please send a resume, a little blurb about yourself and note your availability for a short preliminary phone/zoom interview. We will respond to all qualified, local candidates.

Here is a sample of classes we teach: https://www.paenynj.org/classdescriptions

As of right now we are actively hiring for: Cartoon animation and comics creation, piano, guitar, chess, programmable robots, yoga, LEGO, Sportsworld, ninja academy and dinoworld.

If there is anything you would like us to consider you for you can submit a short recorded video of about 5 min or so showcasing your teaching style/skills for a young elementary aged group class, we’d appreciate it and can follow up with a very short phone or zoom call interview. We can also send you one or two of our typical lessons, if you prefer to showcase something from our curriculum. If you would like to create/share a short instructional video please do so.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $50.00 per hour

Schedule:

* After school

Experience:

* Teaching: 1 year (Required)
* Experience with children: 1 year (Required)
* Classroom management: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Project Manager (Cash Management & Global Banking)
description:
##### **Job Type: Contract**


##### **Job Category: IT**


#### **Job Description**


Job Title: Project Manager (Cash Management & Global Banking)


Job Summary:


The Project Manager will be responsible for overseeing and managing all aspects of cash management and global banking projects. This includes coordinating with various teams to ensure projects are completed on time and within budget, as well as analyzing and implementing process improvements to streamline operations.


Responsibilities and Duties:


1. Develop and implement project plans and timelines for cash management and global banking initiatives.


2. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure project milestones are met.


3. Monitor and track project progress, identifying and addressing any issues or roadblocks.


4. Analyze current processes and systems to identify areas for improvement.


5. Implement changes to streamline operations and improve efficiency.


6. Communicate project updates and status reports to key stakeholders.


7. Ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements and industry standards.


8. Manage project budgets and expenses to ensure projects are completed within budget.


9. Provide guidance and support to team members to ensure project success.


10. Evaluate project outcomes and report on key performance indicators.


Qualifications and Skills:

* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business Administration, or related field.
* Proven experience in project management, preferably in cash management and global banking.
* Strong understanding of banking operations and financial services.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Project management certification (PMP) a plus.
* Knowledge of regulatory requirements and industry standards in cash management and global banking.

title: Parent Aide 127
description:
Catholic Charities, Diocese of Metuchen (CCDOM), with more than 450 employees is a non-profit, social services agency with its mission, driven by Catholic social teaching, of providing quality services with dignity and respect to the poor, vulnerable and all people in need and partnering with families and communities to improve the quality of life. We serve more than 68,000 clients per year throughout Middlesex, Somerset, Hunterdon, and Warren counties in NJ.

**Parent Aide -** Locations vary – Bridgewater and East Brunswick

* Annual Salary = $47,000
* Four (4) Full-time Positions are available

The Parent Aide will provide in-home support and guidance to parents to improve their parenting skills, enhance family functioning, and ensure the safety and well-being of children. This position is part of the Exchange Parent Aide Program, which aims to strengthen families through parent education, support, and case management in the homes of at-risk families.

**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct regular home visits for a caseload of 12-15 clients.
* Conduct family-centered assessments and maintain a family plan, focused on enhancing parenting skills.
* Maintain accurate records.
* Assist with community resources.
* Attend case conferences with DCPP and attend staff meetings.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in social work or related field with at least one year’ experience working with families. However, ***Parent Aides may possess a DED or High School Diploma with 3-5 years’ experience providing direct care to minors and/or related experience in the child welfare system.***
* Candidates with lived experience must have the demonstrated ability to advocate within the system while maintaining appropriate diplomacy while modeling these skills to families being served.
* Must have the ability to work with diverse populations
* Ability to work independently, with effective communication skills, and a valid driver’s license in good standing are also required.
* Evening and weekend work may be required.

**Benefits:**

CCDOM offers a competitive benefits plan that includes:

* Medical and Prescription
* Dental
* Vision
* Up to 13 Paid Holidays
* Begin with 20 Days of Paid Time Off
* Non-Contributory Pension Plan
* Ability to contribute to 403(b) retirement plan
* Life and Disability Insurance

* Employee Assistance Program

* NJM Insurance
* Blue Cross Blue Shield
* Flex Spending Accounts

***Catholic Charities, Diocese of Metuchen is an Equal Opportunity Employer.***

title: Patient Service Coordinator
description:
Caring Connections is a licensed Home Care Service agency providing home care and assistance to seniors and other home-bound individuals, via warm, professionally trained staff who take the needs of your loved ones seriously. We value the families that we serve, and we work hard to make your loved ones feel like we are part of their loving family.

**Job Title: Patient Service Coordinator**

Position Type: Full-Time, In-Office

Schedule: Monday - Friday, with flexibility to participate in on-call rotation weekends as needed

**Job Description:**

We are seeking a highly motivated and professional Patient Service Coordinator to join our fantastic team. The ideal candidate will provide exceptional services to all members, ensuring a high standard of care and support. This role requires a detail-oriented individual with excellent communication and organizational skills, who can thrive in a fast-paced environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

- Answer inbound calls from patients and caregivers in a polite and professional manner.

- Utilize HHA Exchange to manage patient and caregiver schedules.

- Review and update schedules daily to ensure accuracy in assigned caregivers, service days, and service hours.

- Assign available caregivers to open assignments, sourcing the best possible match for all clients based on caregiver skills and availability.

- Review attendance for all caregivers throughout the day to confirm they have arrived at their client's homes and punched in for their assignments.

- Assist caregivers and patients with any inquiries as needed.

- Ensure a high level of customer service and maintain professional relationships with all clients and caregivers.

- Manage an assigned caseload of client services.

- Document changes in services, complaints, and concerns in patient record.

- Communicate with office manager and nurses any concerns or incidents reported by caregivers, client or family members in a timely manner.

- Participate in the on-call rotation on weekends as needed.

- Assist in office as needed.

**Qualifications:**

- Must have experience as a Service Coordinator within a home care agency setting.

- Strong understanding of the urgency in finding and assigning caregivers to clients in a timely manner.

- Ability to work well under pressure and to staff and stabilize cases promptly.

- Professional, proactive, and a team player.

- Excellent computer skills, including proficiency with HHA Exchange or similar scheduling software.

- Outstanding communication and customer service skills.

- Fluent in English.

**Benefits:**

- Competitive salary and benefits package.

- Supportive and collaborative work environment.

- Opportunities for professional development and growth.

If you meet the qualifications and are interested in joining our team, please submit your resume for consideration. We look forward to hearing from you!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $25.00 - $30.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* On call
* Weekends as needed

* Patient Service Coordination: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Airmont, NY 10952 (Required)

*We are currently seeking individuals with Morning availability. If you are an early riser looking for a new challenge and someone who prefers to get to work daytime shifts, we have positions available that will suit your lifestyle. This position is primarily* ***Daytime*** *work that focuses on completing reset projects for local retailers*

  

Travel and training wages vary, depending on local WIS office wages. Ask your recruiter for details. **Benefits of Working with WIS*** **Hiring Immediately!**
* **Referral bonuses**: Get paid for referring friends and family!
* Career **Growth**: WIS is committed to creating opportunities for those who aspire for more. If you are looking for career and promotion opportunities, you can count on us!
* Employee-paid health insurance available at competitive group rates
* Opportunities for **paid travel** and occasional overnight stays
* Other non-reset positions available after completion of project
* Join a supportive environment where diversity is celebrated, and every individual is valued for their unique talents

 **WIS Reset Associate – Days Job Preview**  

The Reset Associate provides support to projects for our customers in a variety of retail, grocery, and warehouse environments. The Reset Associate performs tasks including but not limited to store resets, remodels, reading and acting on planograms, and cleaning and resetting products, shelves, pegs, and tags. The Reset Associate embodies our values of Service, Pride, Integrity, Results, Innovation, and Teamwork, additionally a focus on customer dedication, and making safety and security a personal priority. We are passionate about our people, technology, and process because when you succeed, we succeed! **Team Requirements**  

* Must be at least 18 years of age
* Retail, Reset, Remodel or Merchandising experience is a plus
* Ability be able to work the entire duration of the project they are assigned
* Experience working with planograms and full components of a reset, to deliver excellence to each project is preferred
* Proven ability to work in solo and team environments is required, where team-orientated, highly motivated, and self-driven individuals are preferred
* Effective customer relations skills meant to always deliver exceptional service
* **We encourage applications from candidates who:**
	+ Are returning to the workforce
	+ Have military experience
	+ Do not have a high school or college degree
* **Make your experience count****!** Looking for experience in Retail, Reset, Remodel, Construction, Customer Service, Driver and/or Warehouse work.
* Access to reliable transportation

This part time project position requires the ability to lift and carry items up to 50 lbs., to stand for prolonged periods and the ability to use hands and wrists regularly including repetitive motions. It is also required to work in low-level positions, such as squatting, kneeling, or crouching, as well as frequent standing. Occasional travel may be required via plane or automobile, including overnight stays *Please note that this Job Description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. title: Afterschool ABA Behavior Technician / DSP Essex (n)
description:
Sunshine Advantage is hiring in various locations in Essex County. Areas include Newark and West Orange. Apply today and ask our hiring managers about open positions in your area.

**Position Summary:**

The Behavior Technician is a clinical team member and receives supervision per the leading BCBA. Work consists of providing 1:1 therapy with patients, assisting the BCBA in completing consultations, parent training, collaboration with other team members under the BCBA supervision regarding the assessments, data collection, creating program materials, and other assigned activities. In addition, a professional commitment to working with clients and families for an extended period is expected.

**Benefits of working at Sunshine Advantage:**

Part time flexible schedules – Employees can easily combine this part time position with a full time day job conveniently located near their preferred location

Online and on the job training

Support and assistance obtain to earn credentials to advance your career

to becoming a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)

Supervised Field experience for individuals working towards becoming a BCBA or BCaBA

Referral Bonus

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

Provide 1:1 ABA therapy to children under the clinical supervision of a BCBA or BCaBA.

Follow behavior, individualized treatment plans, and reinforcements as determined by the supervising BCBA.

Complete daily acquisition skills, maintenance, and mastered skills treatment activities.

Implement appropriate teaching strategies and behavior modification approaches stated in the treatment program.

Collect accurate data daily.

Complete billing documentation with parents' signatures.

Attends staff meetings and training as requested.

Completes additional job duties as assigned.

**Minimum Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities):**

High School Diploma, GED

Experience with children with special needs, developmental delays, and/or autism

Training coursework is provided for those that do not have RBT certification.

Confidentiality and discretion pertaining to the work environment and HIPAA requirements are required.

Adhere to Ethical Guidelines set forth by the BACB organization

Obtain or possess updated CPR certification and maintain re-certification every two years

Ability to develop positive working relationships with children, families, employees, and departments, maintaining collaborative professional relationships.

Professionalism and timely communication as outlined by the company.

Background Clearance is mandatory.

Excellent and positive verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

title: Waitstaff
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


One of the strengths that sets The Bristal apart as a luxury assisted living community is our chef-prepared cuisine and the country club dining experience we provide three times a day. We are seeking friendly, professional and, above all, compassionate **Waitstaff** with the kind, patient and cheerful spirit to deliver on that exceptional experience. You know the satisfied feeling you get at an upscale restaurant when the servers do an excellent job? That's the same feeling we wish our residents to have every day, and as part of our Waitstaff team, your performance is key to making that happen. In this role you will be responsible for ensuring all meals are served and presented in accordance with the guidelines established by the Director of Food Service. The loving care, attention and great customer service you bring to the dining experience are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Full Time, Part Time, and Per Diem schedules available


Additional responsibilities include:

* Patiently and cheerfully taking resident meal orders
* Checking station tables for settings and cleanliness
* Reading the menu before service so that you can knowledgeably assist the residents with their selections
* Assisting in the plating and proper portion controls of some or all of the following: appetizers, salads, soups, beverages and desserts
* Bussing tables at the end of the meal


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* Experience as a Waiter/Waitress in a restaurant or food-service-related industry
* Able to function in a fast-paced environment
* Have a strong ability to multi-task
* Possesses good communication, customer service and people skills
* Is professional, patient and able to satisfy a demanding customer base
* Experience working with a senior population is preferred, but not required
* Is a team player, willing to help out where needed to ensure a pleasurable dining experience
* Familiarity with food safety, food preparation and board of health guidelines is a plus
* Is able to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in actions and demeanor
* Maintains an abiding respect for the elderly and remains calm at all times
company_description: The Bristal Assisted Living is the premier in senior living with 24 locations throughout the tri-state area inlcuding Long Island, Westchester, Manhattan, and New Jersey.

description:

We are seeking an experienced **Painter/Maintenance Assistant** to help maintain the prestigious appearance of our luxury assisted living community. You will be painting, staining and touching up high-traffic areas that may not be accessible during the day. At times, you may come into contact with residents, resident families, other guests and team members, and we expect you to maintain a friendly, courteous and positive attitude at all times, so that these encounters are pleasant and professional. The care, attention to detail and superior customer service you bring to your maintenance responsibilities are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Applying paints, stains, surface preparatory materials, and undercoating materials to a variety of surfaces
* Using and operating required tools and equipment skillfully and safely
* Mixing and matching paints and varnishes
* Estimating time and materials required on widely varied assignments
* Following Materials Safety Data Sheets and ensuring compliance with hazardous materials guidelines, as appropriate
* Assisting with plumbing, carpentry, electrical, furniture assembly, snow removal, equipment repair, preventative maintenance and HVAC


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/ qualifications:

* Experience with the residential, commercial, and industrial practices and processes of the painting trade
* Knowledge of the tools, equipment, materials and application techniques common to the painting trade, including paints, varnishes, lacquers, enamels, epoxies, paint removers and related materials
* Knowledge and skill in safely handling hazardous materials, including application and disposal
* Skilled in the preparation and application of paints, stains and surface preparation materials to a wide variety of surfaces (interior and exterior experience preferred)
* A proven ability to paint in a clean and precise manner
* You must be an independent worker and possess the ability to handle a job from start to finish
* Previous maintenance/repair experience is a plus
* Kind, patient and compassionate demeanor when encountering residents, management, family members and other guests
* Must have stable work history and solid work references
* A minimum of a high school diploma is required

You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking a creative, compassionate, hands-on **Lifestyle Coordinator** to assist in presenting and coordinating recreational programs for our assisted living residents, as well as residents with Alzheimer's disease or dementia in our dedicated Reflections Memory Care Neighborhood. You will assist residents in making the adjustment to a new concept of living at our luxury assisted living community, not only encouraging them to continue pursuing their interests, hobbies and lifestyle activities, but also to develop new and stimulating interests, as well. You will help plan fun and safe trips to suitable destinations, such as art galleries, theaters, music venues, racetracks, sports events as well as religious and cultural programs. You will also help prepare, print and distribute copies of our monthly calendar, newsletters and memos to residents. You will also be expected to perform planned activities in the absence of the Director of Recreation. In this role you will maintain a knowledge of resident backgrounds, hobbies, special interests, and spoken languages, etc., and use this knowledge to encourage resident engagement and participation. The loving attention you bring to the assistance you provide is fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Full Time, Part Time, and Per Diem schedules available


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* One year's prior experience working with a senior population, and those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia a plus
* At least 6 months of Recreation activity experience (art therapy, music therapy) or event leadership experience, and preferably in assisted living, long-term care or a similar industry setting
* Be outgoing, warm and have a genuine caring personality
* Able to create programs that get residents involved and excited
* Be dependable and able to supervise activities, special events and safe excursions for the residents
* Has creative talents in one or more areas, such as art, music, readings, dance, etc.
* Always maintaining oneself well-groomed and properly attired
* Demonstrates good listening and communication skills and always presents a positive spirit and professional attitude
* Possesses a proven ability to lead classes and other instructional learning sessions and speak in front of a group setting with ease, confidence and clarity
* Holds a high school diploma or equivalent at a minimum

**New Jersey locations: Must have or be willing to get a COVID-19 vaccine, subject to legal accommodations**

title: Lifestyle Director
description:
**JOB SUMMARY****:**


To plan, develop, coordinate and administer a social, educational and recreational program which meets the psychosocial needs of the Residents within the Assisted Living and Reflections Programs.

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES****:**

* Develop and maintain activities programs for Assisted Living Residents and Reflections Program Residents.
* Assist Residents to continue with interests, hobbies and activities that they have previously pursued.
* Offer new opportunities to enhance their lives with new learning experiences. These via the learning of new crafts, dramatic club, choral groups, discussion groups – new avenues for self-expression.
* Plan and coordinate outings to every conceivable area, i.e., art galleries, theatre, music, racetracks, religious and cultural programs.
* Provide constant activity within the facility, which will allow for the expansion of friendships.
* Assist Residents in the formation of various clubs and organizations and interest groups, thus generating opportunities for leadership and involvement in the workings of the community.
* Plan a monthly calendar of events for Residents that includes on-going diversified activities that meet the religious, social, emotional, educational and recreational needs of the Residents.
* Coordinate Resident monies for special activities and events planned and run by the Recreation Department.
* Write and edit a monthly newsletter, copies of which will be provided to each Resident and appropriate staff. These will be distributed to referral sources and recent inquiries and used as a marketing tool.
* Coordinate transportation for all special trips planned by the Recreation Department.
* Interview all new Residents, provide them with a welcome basket and provide new Resident with orientation to building, available amenities, activities, etc.
* Purchase and prepare seasonal decorations as well as decorate for theme events.
* Establish, conduct and maintain records of Resident Council, its officers, and minutes of each meeting.
* Establish a welcome committee to assure new Residents' move-in will be as smooth as possible.
* Request, in accordance with the activities budget, supplies necessary for the program.
* Maintain knowledge of Residents' backgrounds, hobbies, special interests, languages spoken, etc.
* Coordinate exercise and swim programs for active and/or handicapped Residents according to individual Resident needs.
* Selectively recruit volunteers to assist in social programs.
* Arrange for photographs to be taken at major events and maintain an album of these pictures. Distribute press releases of events to local news media.
* Become knowledgeable on how to operate all equipment necessary to operate the Recreation Department.
* Network with outside contacts to recruit social and educational groups in the community to participate in the Bristal activities.
* Provide positive publicity to the Bristal.
* Perform other duties as assigned by Supervisor or Executive Director.
